metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6619 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The default configuration for MongoDB before 2.3.2 does not validateobjects, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial ofservice (crash) or read system memory via a crafted BSON object in thecolumn name in an insert command, which triggers a buffer over-read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
mongodb-clients - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
mongodb-server - 1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.4.9-1ubuntu2').
